Docs.summary: Represents a collection of choices for the class. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecific.Choices%2A> property of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecific> object retrieves a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection> object. This collection implements the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface (through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.ArrayListCollectionBase> object); it implements all properties and methods of the <xref:System.Collections.ICollection> interface.
## Examples The following code example shows how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection> class to gain access to the choices in a DeviceSpecific/Choice construct. For your convenience, a Web.config file containing the filters follows the example code.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

remarks.format:
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the Add method to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoice> object programmatically (with a filter named `isCHTML10`) to the form. This example is part of a larger example for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection> overview.

Docs.summary: Adds a choice at the location in the collection specified by the parameter. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A value of -1 for the `index` parameter specifies that the command is added to the end of the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void Clear() cil managed

Docs.summary: Clears the collection. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is not available in the read-only <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.IObjectListFieldCollection> interface. You can use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection.Clear%2A> method for all the classes where this method applies. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection.Clear%2A> method for a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.StyleSheet> collection clears all the styles in the collection; or for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.DeviceSpecificChoiceCollection>, it clears all the choices in the collection. Adding a field to the fields of an object list changes the data-binding behavior of the control, and requires you to bind data to the control again.
